alert.note: Alert for DeKalb; Marshall (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 06 at 5:50PM CDT by NWS Huntsville
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Marshall and southwestern DeKalb Counties through 630 PM CDT... At 550 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Snead, or 12 miles southwest of Albertville, moving north at 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Albertville, Boaz, Crossville, Douglas, High Point, Horton, Arona, Kilpatrick, Rodentown and Hyatt. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
